00015 /**
00016  * smarty view class. used to render the view (and layout) for the controller. ALPHAish.
00017  * to use put the following in your controller:
00018  * <code>
00019  * public $view = 'SmartyView';
00020  * </code>
00021  *
00022  * @package kata_view
00023  */

00027      * hold smarty-object
00028      *
00029      * @var object
00030      */
00031     protected $smarty = null;

00033     /**
00034      * constructor. copies all needed variables from the controller
00035      * @param object controller that uses this view
00036      */
00037     function __construct(& $controller) {
00038         /**
00039          * include smarty. a smarty-installation must be in your include path!
00040          */
00041         require_once 'Smarty.class.php';
00042         
00043         parent::__construct();
00044 
00045         $this->smarty = new Smarty;
00046         $this->smarty->register_function('helper', array (
00047                 'SmartyView',
00048                 'smarty_helper'
00049         ));
00050     }

00052     /**
00053      * allow smarty to use helpers
00054      */
00055     function smarty_helper($params, & $smarty) {
00056         if (empty ($params['name'])) {
00057             throw new InvalidParameterException('smarty: {helper} needs name=');
00058         }
00059         if (!isset ($this->helperClasses[$params['name']])) {
00060             throw new InvalidParameterException('smarty: ' . $params['name'] . '-helper not found');
00061         }
00062         $helpername = $params['name'];
00063         unset ($params['name']);
00064         return call_user_func_array($this->helperClasses[$helpername], $params);
00065     }

00067     /**
00068      * render the actual view and layout. normally done at the end of a action of a controller
00069      * <code>
00070      * 1. all helpers are constructed here, very late, so we dont accidently waste cpu cycles
00071      * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00072      * 3. the actual view-template is rendered
00073      * 4. the content of the rendered view is rendered into the layout
00074      * </code>
00075      * @param string $action name of the view
00076      * @param string $layout name of the layout
00077      * @return string html of the view
00078      */
00079     public function render($action, $layout) {
00080         $this->action = $action;
00081 
00082         $this->constructHelpers();
00083         $this->smarty->assign('params', $this->controller->params);
00084         $this->smarty->assign($this->passedVars);
00085         $this->smarty->assign($this->controller->viewVars);
00086 
00087         $viewfile = ROOT . 'views' . DS . strtolower(substr(get_class($this->controller), 0, -10)) . DS . $action . ".tpl";
00088         if (!file_exists($viewfile)) {
00089             throw new Exception('Cant find template [' . $this->action . '] of controller [' . get_class($this->controller) . '], Path is [' . $viewfile . ']');
00090         }
00091         return $this->smarty->fetch($viewfile);
00092     }
00093 
00094     /**
00095      * renders the given string into the layout. normally called by renderView()
00096      * <code>
00097      * 1. title and content are extracted into global namespace
00098      * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00099      * 3. the given string is rendered into the layout
00100      * 4. the html-output of this routine normally lands in the controllers output property
00101      * </code>
00102      * @param string $contentForLayout raw html to be rendered to the layout (normally the content of a view)
00103      * @param string $layout name of the layout
00104      */
00105     public function renderLayout($contentForLayout, $layout) {
00106         $this->layoutName = $layout;
00107         if ($this->layoutName !== null) {
00108             $this->constructHelpers();
00109 
00110             $this->smarty->assign('content_for_layout', $contentForLayout);
00111             $this->smarty->assign('title_for_layout', $this->controller->pageTitle);
00112             $this->smarty->assign('params', $this->controller->params);
00113             $this->smarty->assign($this->controller->viewVars);
00114 
00115             $layoutfile = ROOT . 'views' . DS . 'layouts' . DS . $this->layoutName . '.tpl';
00116             if (!file_exists($layoutfile)) {
00117                 throw new Exception('Cant find layout template [' . $this->layoutName . ']');
00118             }
00119             return $this->smarty->fetch($layoutfile);
00120         } else {
00121             return $contentForLayout;
00122         }
00123     }

00125     /**
00126      * render a element and return the resulting html. an element is kind of like a mini-view you can use inside a view (via $this->renderElement()).
00127      * it has (like a view) access to all variables a normal view has
00128      * @param string $name name of the element (see views/elements/) without .thtml
00129      * @param an array of variables the element can access in global namespace
00130      */
00131     public function renderElement($name, $params = array ()) {
00132         $this->elementName = $name;
00133         $this->smarty->assign($this->controller->viewVars);
00134         $this->smarty->assign($params);
00135 
00136         $elemfile = ROOT . 'views' . DS . 'elements' . DS . $this->elementName . ".thtml";
00137         if (!file_exists($elemfile)) {
00138             throw new Exception('Cant find element [' . $this->elementName . ']');
00139         }
00140         return $this->smarty->fetch($elemfile);
00141     }
